Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a clear and accurate string telephone showing how two students use it to communicate over a distance, with two cups connected by a taut string.
The student can illustrate the string as a critical component for the transmission of sound, ensuring the string is straight and without slack.
The student can show that the device uses sound to send and receive information, possibly adding sound waves or arrows to indicate sound traveling from one cup to another.

The student can describe through their drawing how using such a device helps people communicate over distances, possibly including small annotations or speech bubbles to show the transmission of information.
The student can depict the basic structure of the device accurately using specified materials such as cups and string, without additional unnecessary elements.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally forget to label one of the components, such as omitting a label on one of the cups or the string, but the drawing still clearly represents all parts.
